cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-north-east, intensify over the eastern Gulf of Mexico, make landfall along Florida’s Big Bend, then sweep northeast across southern Georgia and the coastal Carolinas before moving offshore into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (between Englewood and Indian Pass, near Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge Watches posted from Englewood FL to Indian Pass FL (Gulf coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings for parts of the Yucatan Peninsula and western Cuba (no Atlantic-side warnings yet)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West coast of Florida, Florida Panhandle, southern Georgia, and the coasts of Georgia–South Carolina–North Carolina within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph with higher gusts) are possible late Wednesday as the center passes inland west of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible, but surge heights currently forecast below 3 ft along the Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainbands Tuesday night through Wednesday; 3–6 inches with locally higher amounts could trigger flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and brief navigation restrictions from reduced visibility and squalls
